Message.Title: First design win for Tegra 4i: Motorola X phone specs leaked..
Message.Msg: Apparently today is a big day for leaks. After the supposed first images of the Samsung Galaxy S IV (or one of its variants) were outed earlier, now we get some alleged details about Motorola’s famous X Phone, along with a pretty blurry shot of a slide depicting its design. Or something along those lines, since it’s pretty hard to see much, except that it’s going to be a very square affair. The X Phone has long been rumored as the first device to come out of Motorola under Google’s supervision. The search giant bought the ailing phone maker a while back, but ever since all the phones launched under the Motorola logo had already been ‘in the pipeline’ when that happened. So the X Phone brings us the promise of a Nexus-like experience, only made by Motorola. Something to really compete with the Galaxy S IV and the HTC One, if you will. So color us disappointed if this rumor pans out. According to it, the X Phone will have an Nvidia Tegra 4i processor. That’s not the Tegra 4, mind you. The Tegra 4i was announced last month and is Nvidia’s first chipset that integrates an LTE modem. However, in terms of CPU and GPU performance, it’s not as great as the Tegra 4 (as that’s based on the newest ARM architecture, Cortex-A15, while the Tegra 4i uses the Cortex-A9 design that was popular in last year’s flagship phones). Of course this doesn’t mean that the Tegra 4i will be underpowered or unable to serve the X Phone’s needs well, but it won’t be ‘the cream of the crop’. Which is an odd decision for what has always been rumored to be the flagship device for Motorola this year. unwiredviewDOTcom/2013/03/11/motorola-x-phone-details-specs-and-blurry-image-leaked/ ________ Nothing to be disappointed about, folks! Tegra 4i retains 80% of Tegra 4's performance, yet lighter and cheaper and giving you much longer battery life.

Topic.Title: First design win for Tegra 4i: Motorola X phone specs leaked..

Topic.Title: First design win for Tegra 4i: Motorola X phone specs leaked..

Message.Msg: If true, Motorola X phone should outperform both Samsung Galaxy IV (Snapdragon 600 or Exynos 5 Octa) and HTC ONE (Snapdragon 600) based on Antutu benchmarks which have been reported for both Exynos Octa and S600. This is the logic: Tegra 4i = 80% Tegra 4 Exynos 5 Octa = 50% of Tegra 4 S 600 = 50% of Tegra 4 T4i will beat both of the competitor handset and then some.

Topic.Title: First design win for Tegra 4i: Motorola X phone specs leaked..

Message.Msg: The Moto X phone/Tegra 4i news is now all over the web. Below is another write-up by Softpedia: "Coming from AndroidWorld, said report claims that the upcoming device will feature a 4.7-inch touchscreen display capable of delivering a full HD resolution, and that it would be powered by an NVIDIA Tegra 4i processor. Furthermore, the news site claims that Google and Motorola might pack the device with impressive imaging and video recording / chatting capabilities, courtesy of a 16-megapixel photo snapper on the back, paired with a 5MP camera on the front. The device, said to be only 7.9mm thin (it will measure 131.2 x 66.7 x 7.9mm, it seems), is also expected to feature “eye tracking” capabilities, aimed at enabling users to scroll on web pages without touching the screen (Galaxy S IV was rumored to include similar technology as well).

Message.Title: Susquehanna will be getting nervous, soon.
Message.Msg: I've been out most of the day, and just found out about the desperate and disingenuous downgrade by Susquehanna. They will begin to get more and more nervous as they realize that their "sell" rating is being met with no volume and very little price movement. Believe me, they did not think this would only get the stock down by 10-20 cents, and was a last ditch effort to keep the stock from staying over the 200DMA. As Ibexx said, they are really a Hedge Fund, and they are probably short a bunch of the stock and the March 13 calls. I'm quite surprised, actually, that they didn't wait to see how the stock did the first few days of the week and come out with this on Thursday or even Friday. Now, they've spent their ammunition, and will have to deal with what comes now. I have no way to know if the market or the stock will rally, today, or this week, other than to say that with volume this low, most participants are ignoring this call, at best, and some might show the firm up by taking the stock up through 13 just to spite them. Keep an eye on the volume and if we should close above the 200DMA, again today, I think their call will look ridiculous. We're right at the highs of the day and above the 200DMA. My "guess" is we continue higher and who knows, maybe even finish up on the day. THAT would show them...;) As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Max

Message.Title: Fake Motorola X Phone specs
Message.Msg: intomobileDOTcom/2013/03/11/dont-fooled-fake-motorola-x-phone-specs-floating-around/ Don’t be fooled by the fake Motorola X Phone specs floating around Categories: Android, Google, Hardware, Motorola, Rumors By: George Tinari, IntoMobile Monday, March 11th, 2013 at 9:34 AM You might be seeing a lot of headlines around the web today along the lines of “Motorola X Phone specs leak out!” You also may have noticed that headline is nowhere to be found on IntoMobile. That’s because thanks to the nice work over at Droid-Life, the image and specs have been debunked. The image with the label “Motorola NXT” rather than “X” surfaced on foreign Android news site AndroidWorld. It’s the first time the rumored X device from Motorola and Google has been referred to as “NXT.” That’s already worthy of suspicion, but then we get to the specs, which only add to the confusion. According to this rumor, the X — or NXT, or whatever the hell it’s supposed to be — is supposed to have a 4.7-inch HD display, NVIDIA Tegra 4i chipset, 16MP rear camera and a 5MP front camera. Since the 4i doesn’t support CDMA networks, unless Motorola’s X Phone was going to be an LTE-only phone (which is just short of impossible) then it would be ditching support for Verizon or Sprint in the U.S. by going with the 4i. If that’s not enough, AndroidWorld updated its article with a few sentences after finding out the tipster created the entire image you see above itself. It’s not officially from Motorola, not leaked, and therefore not legitimate. The website had already mentioned earlier in the post that it should be taken “with a very large grain of salt.” Sorry X Phone enthusiasts, but you’ll have to keep waiting for now. [via Droid-Life]

Topic.Title: Fake Motorola X Phone specs

Message.Msg: You do realize that Verizon themselves have stated (or at least strongly hinted) that they will no longer be supporting in CDMA in their 2014 handsets? So whatever turns out to be true about the Motorola X, the value placed on CDMA for handsets will be diminished by the end of this year. Also, the same Tegra chip, 4i, does support the TD-SCDMA spec. Nvidia is not supporting CDMA to maximize margin, not because their modem is incapable of supporting CDMA. They, like Verizon, are tired of paying Qualcomm all the royalties and surchages.

Topic.Title: Susquehanna will be getting nervous, soon.

Message.Msg: I bothered to go to Susquehanna's website. They are a high frequency trading firm with a specialization in options. The top employee benefit they list is an annual massive Texas Holdem tournament for their employees....interesting combination. Notice almost zero block trades except at the open and close. Also the analyst that did the downgrade in late 2010 had $9 price target at the end of 2010 and then upgraded his rating to neutral when the stock hit $24.50. I don't know if I want to make any investment decisions from their ratings. Call me when JP Morgan, Merrill Lynch, or Goldman Sachs weigh in. In the meantime....IMHO... the Nvidia Tech Science fair is important not because of all the tech stuff. Ehat is important is the embedded financial analyst presentation right after Jensen's keynote....Cruel...but some of the bored WS types may actually watch the keynote...but you know everyone will watch the financial presentation. Here's hoping he makes it simple and lays out the yearly plan for revenue and earnings. Note: Analysts have been begging for it for 3 months because Nvidia has entered or about to enter so many new businesses that no one can put together any cohesive financial model. Here's hoping it's simple and specific.....Here's the Tam and here is what our bonus goals are built on. Stock buy back plan should be included....yes they did buy $100M in the 4th qtr....how about the plans for 2013? JMHO

Message.Msg: That's a worthwhile observation. It seems that their stock recommendations/downgrades are entirely based on their existing position in the stock. I looked for one of their recommendations about six months ago. Five months ago (bad calendar counting on my part) they downgraded Greenhill (NYSE:GHL) when it was about $50. The price dipped a bit, following the market, but is now about $60. Great call. Actually it probably was, for them. Presumably they covered their short position when their downgrade caused the price to temporarily drop.

Topic.Title: Susquehanna will be getting nervous, soon.

Message.Msg: Mslans- Right about the time I wrote that, the stock had recovered to 12.75, and it had the look of a stock that was going to go right back to unched or up on the day. It didn't. However, even with the ensuing sell off and lack of volume, the stock did recover to close ABOVE the 200DMA and ABOVE the down opening price...albeit by 1/2 cent, but that is still important. When a stock gaps up or down, it's quite important to see if it closes above that opening price. So, as had been the case, quite often in NVDA, the stock would gap UP and then close flat or lower on the day, but surely below the opening price. Today it was the opposite, and this is what is going to make the shorts nervous. NO volume on a "sell" call, and NO real downward movement. (They definitely were looking for more than a 12 cent loss.) And, I do believe they WERE nervous when the stock got back to 12.75, and again when it got back to 12.72 in the last 1/2 hour. At 3:30, the stock had traded 5.169mm shares and was at 12.62-.63...at 4:00, the stock had traded ANOTHER 2.3mm shares and was at 12.69-70, closing at 12.695 (I must say I've NEVER seen ANOTHER stock trade at so many fractions of a penny, EVER), which was above the 12.69 open. So, while I may be wrong for this week (but there's PLENTY of time), and maybe we won't get over 13, we are getting closer to seeing the kind of move up in NVDA that BBRY had, today. And when it DOES happen, you'll see some explosive volume and a major league fight, but when the Bulls win, it will be for a pretty long ride. And, don't forget, while NVDA HAS been one of the worst performers over the last 5 years, people were SURE that NVDA would be put out of business by INTC. Jen Hsun has done an incredible job of reinventing the company and the fruits of that labor are coming soon. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Best, Max

Message.Title: Linley Group - "Nvidia ‘Tegra 4′ Trumps Fastest QCOM ‘Snapdragon,’
Message.Msg: The Microprocessor Report from the Linley Group costs a bundle and highlights don't get into public view right away. "Venerable chip analysts Microprocessor Report today offer up an assessment of Nvidia‘s (NVDA) “Tegra 4” application processor as to how it stacks up against Qualcomm‘s (QCOM) “Snapdragon” family of processors, based on benchmark data released by Nvidia two weeks ago at the Mobile World Congress show in Barcelona. (All articles require a subscription to Microprocessor Report.) The conclusion of the Report’s Kevin Krewell is that Tegra 4 is the fastest mobile processor using ARM Holdings (ARMH) technology, even in comparison to the fastest projected versions of Snapdragon: At MWC, the company continued its product reve- lation by disclosing new details of the architecture and its capabilities (as well as limitations). Judging from this pre- liminary information, Tegra 4 rates as the highest-perform- ing mobile ARM processor—if power constraints don’t throttle the cores. This performance takes aim at Qual- comm’s newest Snapdragon processors; Nvidia offered a wide range of benchmark results that clearly showed Tegra 4 leading both the APQ8064 and (judging from our estimates) the forthcoming Snapdragon 800 […] We also estimated the performance of the Snap- dragon Series 800, assuming that it will achieve its rated 2.3GHz clock speed and applying a 10% gain to represent the improvements from the Krait 200 CPU to the Krait 400 CPU. This approach is probably optimistic, as most bench- mark scores do not improve linearly with CPU speed, although the Series 800 will also get a boost from faster DRAM. Based on these estimates, even Qualcomm’s best processor, which is due to enter production at about the same time as Tegra 4, won’t surpass Nvidia in these tests. Krewell argues Qualcomm still has some advantage for devices that use less than the maximum power possible: Tegra 4 delivers outstanding benchmark results, showing off its considerable capabilit

Topic.Title: Linley Group - "Nvidia ‘Tegra 4′ Trumps Fastest QCOM ‘Snapdragon,’

Message.Msg: end of meassage got cut off - Source Barrons "capabilities. These results seem to have caught Qualcomm by surprise and expose some deficiencies in the memory subsystem of the Krait- based processors. Qualcomm, however, has designed its CPU for power efficiency, whereas Tegra 4 delivers maxi- mum performance at maximum power. Snapdragon will challenge Tegra 4’s performance in smartphones, but in tablets, Tegra 4 will really shine."

Topic.Title: Linley Group - "Nvidia ‘Tegra 4′ Trumps Fastest QCOM ‘Snapdragon,’

Message.Msg: Chitown, At the MWC in Barcelona, NV set up demo units to show energy savings of T4 reference tablet vs leading competition products as well as benchmark comparisons. In several tests (synthetic as well as real life web loading), T4 would afford 20-25% energy savings. Of course S800 wasn't there for comparison, but on it is safe to assume that S800 will be no more energy efficient than S600 as the former is expected to be clocked up considerably. I don't really know on what grounds that Linley made that remark. All look good to me...

Message.Title: Cox Communications S. California - Cloud Gaming with Nvidia Grid - Gone Live
Message.Msg: "Playpalooza - True cloud gaming in your living room With over 6 million customers and over 22,000 employees, Cox is the third-largest cable entertainment and broadband services provider in the country. Cox Communications Inc. is best known for pioneering the bundle of television, Internet and telephone services together, offering consumers the ability to consolidate their services with one provider. When Cox Communications partnered with G-Cluster to create a brand new streaming gaming platform for their cable TV customers, they turned to ChannelReady to get the message out. We rolled out an integrated promotional microsite and demo video that shows off the uniqueness of Playpalooza. We made sure the site looked great on a computer, tablet or smartphone using our SmartSite platform. Then we used our SmartMetrics tools to give Cox regular updates on how customers were interacting with the site. We helped Cox get their story to the right audience and made sure they were engaged and clicking." source: channelreadyDOTcom/Storytelling/CoxCommunications _____________________________________________________________________________ G-Cluster is one of Nvidia's 6 partners for Nvidia Grid

Message.Title: Ubitus Celerates One Million LTE Cloud Gaming Users
Message.Msg: "AIPEI, Taiwan, Feb. 26, 2013 /PRNewswire/ -- Ubitus Inc., the worldwide technology leader in cloud gaming solutions, today announced its GameCloud® solution has empowered worldwide leading carriers to reach one million LTE cloud gaming users spanning across the United States, Japan, South Korea and Hong Kong. Ubitus GameCloud®, a holistic turnkey solution designed to support simple adaptation of original PC/MMO games to run across multiple device platforms over cloud and most concurrent users support with lowest power consumption, has successfully enabled multiple global top-tier LTE carriers, including but not limited to Verizon Wireless, NTT DoCoMo, LG U+, and One2free, to commercially bring their cloud gaming services to the market since September 2011. The "one million" record to date also marks Ubitus as the dominant cloud gaming provider in Android-based LTE phones and tablets. "It's truly amazing to see how fast the one-million-user milestone has reached in such a short period of time, and this again proves that consumers would embrace new way of gaming experience as long as the service adds value to their lives," said Wesley Kuo, CEO of Ubitus. "We are extremely proud to work with our customers in shifting to a new gaming paradigm for the masses." ______________________________________________________________________________ Ubitus is also one of the 6 partners using Nvidia Grid. Did you notice Verizon wireless...must be in trials.

Message.Title: Performance wise, Tegra 4i could potentially take on Snapdragon 800, at half the size and one third the cost
Message.Msg: Let's just look at the numbers in a simplistic way: Using Antutu as the benchmarking tool: --Tegra 4i performs at 80% of Tegra 4 (per Matt Wuebbling, NV Tegra product manager) 36489 x 0.8 = 29191 --Snapdragon S800 is 25% faster than Snapdragon 600 (Qualcomm's own marketing claim) 22678 x 1.25 = 28347 Conclusion: Tegra 4i could even be slightly faster than S800! Reference: phonearena.DOTcom/news/NVIDIA-Tegra-4-beats-Qualcomm-Snapdragon-600-in-benchmark-tests_id40160 (Antutu score for Tegra 4 = 36489; Aututu score for HTC One (S600) = 22678 In addition to cost and size advantages, Tegra 4 is fully integrated with LTE, whereas in S800, the LTE radio is ""on die"" - not integrated - sort of like AMD's APU.

Message.Title: Tegra4-Tegra 4i
Message.Msg: Every first-hand report published describes nothing but extraordinary speed and efficiency.

Topic.Title: Cox Communications S. California - Cloud Gaming with Nvidia Grid - Gone Live

Message.Msg: This is huge - win win for the cable company, Nvidia and the gaming company. All the Cable companies will build their next generation STB using Tegra - this provides a ubiquitous solution for the traditional STB function whilst upgrading it to 4K resolution (new Cable TV service upgrade for special programs) as well lag free PC and Android games subscription service all in the same box- plus accessory sales. Selling Grid hardware - selling Shield - Selling Tegras for STBs and selling Tegras for connected TVs Nice & Cool - running circles around QC
